channel.title: Version Control on (thoughts) => TryParse(thoughts, out blog)
channel.description: Recent content in Version Control on (thoughts) => TryParse(thoughts, out blog)

item.title: Git checkout error for public repo
item.description: One of those djissis duh moments - trying to check out a public git repo, but failing due to authentication … git clone git@github.com:cobusbernard/Scripts.git Cloning into 'Scripts'... Warning: Permanently added the RSA host key for IP address '192.30.252.131' to the list of known hosts. Permission denied (publickey). fatal: Could not read from remote repository. Please make sure you have the correct access rights and the repository exists. So I checked my ssh setup / keys, but nothing in there looks dodgy:

item.title: Migrating repo from SVN to Git RPC error
item.description: While I was working on Dementium II HD, I wanted to migrate the repository from SVN to Git. It was being hosted on a machine in the one studio and served the external developers over a 10mbit ADSL connection. The upstream rate is ~400kbit, so imagine trying to checkout a 26GB repository. I ran into the following error when I tried to import the SVN repo into a Git one:
